metadata.name: Suspicious Windows Strings In URI
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious Windows strings in URI which could indicate possible exfiltration or webshell communication

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM http_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('=c:/users')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('=c:/program%20files')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('=c:/windows')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('=c%3a%5cusers')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('=c%3a%5cprogram%20files')) OR contains(lower(http_request.args), lower('=c%3a%5cwindows')))

output.summary: Detects suspicious Windows strings in URI which could indicate possible exfiltration or webshell communication

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate application and websites that use windows paths in their URL Reference: https://thedfirreport.com/2022/06/06/will-the-real-msiexec-please-stand-up-exploit-leads-to-data-exfiltration/
